result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 5th and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI 5th and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter G. Paulson was found guilty of OWI 5th, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall attend the next victim impact panel.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence is to begin May 4, 2016 at noon.  The jail sentence may be served with good time.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

To Attend Victim Impact Panel

Defendant Peter G. Paulson in court with attorney Damon P. Stichert.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of  no contest to count 1 - OWI 5th .    Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 - OWI 5th offense. Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Stichert. No Statement by defendant.   Court orders withheld sentence probation three years; $2,452.00 fine no DNA surcharge; eight months county jail with huber and good time to begin today; $41.00 blood draw; 30 month revocation of driver's license retroactive to any administrative suspension; IID for one year; AODA; OWI victim impact panel; DNA sample, but no surcharge imposed.    Court dismisses Count 2, 3 and Case No. 14TR406.  One day sentence credit.  - rt

Defendant Peter G. Paulson appeared by phone with attorney Damon P. Stichert.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 11:30 a.m., appearances noted.  Court in statement:  Findings - Dep. Kawalski made arrest, DE refused blood draw.  Search Warrant for blood, affidavit for OWI Search Warrant was presented to Judge Knox-Bauer. Probable cause was found.  Search warrant for draw sample was .210%.  Court sites (489US502) (248W12881) (133SC552).  Request for second search warrant - denied. SS.

Defendant Peter G. Paulson in court with attorney Damon P. Stichert by telephone conference.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Tlusty and court reporter by conference telephone.  Case called at 11:50 am.  Defense acknowleges receipt of information; waived formal reading of same; entered pleas of not guilty to all the charges.  Matter to be schedule for a Pre-trial conference.  Parties to contact Judge Tlusty's assistant no later than 02-06-2015 to schedule the matter further.
Arraignment on December 19, 2014 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Peter G. Paulson in court with attorney Damon P. Stichert.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Chad Kowalczyk sworn and examined.  Exhibit #1 marked and received.  Argument.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over.  Information filed.  Attorney Stichert requested that arraignment be held on another date by phone.  Judge Tlusty's judicial assistant will schedule for an arraignment hearing.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant Peter G. Paulson in court with attorney Damon P Stichert.  Kristi S Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of the complaint.  Waive time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Attorney Stichert requesting bond be modified that defendant shall not possess alcohol for personal consumption but may possess alcohol as part of his business.  Argument by counsel.   Court modifies bond that defendant not possess any alcohol for personal use or consumption.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.  - rt

OWI

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
arrest

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $5000 signature bond  with conditions of:  comply with booking; not possess or consume alcohol; do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for 06-17-2014  at 1:00 p.m.
